snippet: A New Zealand lizard called the tuatara eats like no other animal — sliding its lower jaw forward and backward, it can slice its food like a steak knife.
abstract: Dr Marc E H Jones study in journal The Anatomical Record finds that the tuatara lizard of New Zealand chews by sliding its lower jaw forward and backward, slicing the food like a knife; chewing method is unique among animals.
lead_paragraph: A New Zealand lizard called the tuatara eats like no other animal — sliding its lower jaw forward and backward, it can slice its food like a steak knife.

headline.print_headline: A Unique Slice-and-Dice Strategy for Chewing
headline.seo: The Tuatara’s Unique Slice-and-Dice Strategy for Chewing
headline.main: A Unique Slice-and-Dice Strategy for Chewing
